>> Why not reset them to their initial state in your TestCase.setUp().
>
>That is a much more useful suggestion.  I say go with that.
>
>My guess is that your test cases depend on one another, and
particularly
>depend on
>running in a particular order.  If the test cases run in separate
class
>loaders,
>though, they might as well all be run by themselves.  See if perhaps
that
>is your
>problem.

Perhaps your problem is that you need class variables in the first
place. Perhaps you can easily refactor the code to talk to a
collaborator, rather than class variables. Simple collaboration among
objects is much easier to test.
